history.content:
You should ask your advisor about this; it'll likely be handled on a case by case basis.

Updates are here: @12199

You should ask your advisor about this; it'll likely be handled on a case by case basis.

Updates are here: @12199
You should ask your advisor about this; it'll likely be handled on a case by case basis.

Reach out to your College (ESS or L&S) advisor in regards to whether it might be possible to change your grading option after the deadline.  If it is possible to override the deadline, it is not at the department level.

I'm really sorry you are having such a difficult time. While I hope the end of the term provides relief, you --and others feeling overwhelmed etc -- should definitely reach out for support.

Please see https://uhs.berkeley.edu/caps ("Students with urgent concerns should call 510-642-9494 to speak with a counselor as a first step.")

children.subject:
I was in a similar situation as OP, and I went straight to my L&S advisor to ask if I could switch my grading option. They told me no even though I had been extremely stressed at the time because I found out I couldn’t graduate.

Please let me know if you do get in contact with an advisor who does change it for you though. It might be up to the advisor who helps you.

history.content: I totally forgot to change back after I switched to graded a while ago. I don't know if I wouldve even made that switch idk it was so stressful to decide. Do you think it might still be possible to switch to P/NP? I am so stressed, tired, overwhelmed, exhausted...everything bad...
history.subject: Can we still switch to pass no pass by asking our advisor
